full_history.content: Show me Section 1607.12.1 of the Virginia Building Code

Section 1607.12.1 of the Virginia Construction Code (part of the USBC) allows for reduced live loads on structural members under specific conditions.  This reduction applies to members supporting two or more floors (with a maximum reduction of 20%) and other uses besides storage where a registered design professional justifies the reduction. [https://up.codes/viewer/virginia/ibc-2021/chapter/16/structural-design]  The key provision is that this reduction is permitted when the value of KLLA<sub>T</sub> is 400 square feet (37.16 m<sup>2</sup>) or more.  The reduced live load, L, is calculated using Equation 16-7:  L = L<sub>o</sub>(0.25 + 15/âˆš(K<sub>LL</sub> A<sub>T</sub>)).  [https://up.codes/viewer/virginia/ibc-2015/chapter/16/structural-design]

The provided research includes references to this equation as "Image 7" and the variable definitions as "Image 8," but the actual images are not included in the context.  Therefore, I cannot fully explain the equation or its components without the visual aids. To accurately interpret and apply this section, I need the missing images depicting Equation 16-7 and its variable definitions. I also need the definitions of L<sub>o</sub> and K<sub>LL</sub> to properly calculate the reduced live load. Although some context mentions L<sub>o</sub> as the unreduced roof live load [https://up.codes/viewer/virginia/ibc-2015/chapter/16/structural-design], it's unclear if this applies in all instances of 1607.12.1.
